body: Does it mean that we only use "not" for float? Since "not" is a boolean operator, should we only leave the bool overload instead and let every expr after "not" to use the "bool()" type cast?
body_html: Does it mean that we only use "not" for float? Since "not" is a boolean operator, should we only leave the bool overload instead and let every expr after "not" to use the "bool()" type cast?
body_text: Does it mean that we only use "not" for float? Since "not" is a boolean operator, should we only leave the bool overload instead and let every expr after "not" to use the "bool()" type cast?
